com.sterlingcommerce.ui.web.framework.utils

Class SCXmlBeanUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sterlingcommerce.ui.web.framework.utils.SCXmlBeanUtils

  • public final class SCXmlBeanUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides utilities to convert a XML document to a java bean and vice versa
    Conversion Rules:
    • Only Java Beans can be converted/created using the utilities provided in this class
    • All Java primitives, Dates, Strings are treated as attributes
    • Date attributes in XML have to be in the ISO Date Time format. (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ)
    • All other Beans are converted to elements
    • Names of attributes and elements in the JSON remain the same as in the Java Bean

    SCJsonBeanUtils provides utilities required for converting a json to a java bean and vice versa. statikonda SCJsonBeanUtils

      • getBean

        public static java.lang.Object getBean(java.io.Reader reader,
                                       java.lang.Class beanClass,
                                       java.util.HashMap beanClassInfoMap)
        Converts a xml input into a java bean.
        Example Java Bean definitions: 
         public class Order {
        private Address billTo = null;
        private Address shipTo = null;
        private String orderNo = null;
        private Date orderDate = null;
        ... public getters and setters ...
 }
 
 public class Address {
        private String addressLine1 = null;
        private String state = null;
        private String city = null;
        private String zip = null;
        ... public getters and setters ...
 }
        Code Usage: 
         String xmlStr = "
                        <Order orderDate='2008-07-01T15:38:15' orderNo='TestOrder'>
                                <billTo addressLine1='Adress1BillTo' city='city' state='state' zip='1234'/> 
                                <shipTo addressLine1='Adress1ShipTo' city='city' state='state' zip='1234'/>
                        </Order>
                        ";
 StringReader reader = new StringReader(xmlStr);
 Order order = (Order) SCXmlBeanUtils.getBean(reader, Order.class);
        reader The xml input to be converted into a java bean beanClass The type of bean which needs to be created beanClassInfoMap A hashmap of name - class entries used to determine the runtime The newly created bean instance, or null in case of errors
